subject: Negotiation
title: Uber's Failed China Negotiation
description: A 60-second lesson on Uber's Failed China Negotiation.

hook.text: Uber spent $2 billion trying to win China â€” then sold its Chinese business to the competitor beating it.

buildup.text: Uber entered China in 2013, burning billions in subsidies to gain market share against Didi.

discovery.text: Didi had local knowledge, government relationships, and cultural advantages Uber couldn't match.

twist.text: Uber eventually surrendered China in exchange for a 17.5% stake in Didi â€” turning loss into investment.

climax.text: Knowing when to stop fighting and cut a deal saved Uber from an even bigger disaster.

punchline.text: The best deal is sometimes admitting you can't win and getting something for leaving.

quiz.question: How did Uber turn its China failure into a partial win?
options: They traded their operations for a stake in the competitor
